Tidy the data frame outputted by scan_pvl for further analysis & plotting

Source: R/tidy_scan_pvl.R
tidy_scan_pvl.Rd

Tidy the data frame outputted by scan_pvl for further analysis & plotting

tidy_scan_pvl(mytib, pmap, phenames = c("trait1", "trait2"))

Arguments

mytib

outputted tibble from scan_pvl
pmap

physical map (in Mb) or genetic map (in cM) for exactly one chromosome
phenames

vector of length 2 containing two trait names

See also

Other profile log-likelihood tibble functions: add_intercepts, add_pmap, assemble_profile_tib, transform_loglik_mat

Examples

# read data
iron <- qtl2::read_cross2(system.file("extdata", "iron.zip", package="qtl2"))
# insert pseudomarkers into map
map <- qtl2::insert_pseudomarkers(iron$gmap, step=1)
# calculate genotype probabilities
probs <- qtl2::calc_genoprob(iron, map, error_prob=0.002)
# grab phenotypes and covariates; ensure that covariates have names attribute
pheno <- iron$pheno
# leave-one-chromosome-out kinship matrices
kinship <- qtl2::calc_kinship(probs, "loco")$`1`
# get founder allele probabilites
probs <- qtl2::genoprob_to_alleleprob(probs)$`1`
ac <- matrix(as.numeric(iron$covar$sex == "m", ncol = 1))
colnames(ac) <- "sex"
rownames(ac) <- rownames(probs)
ss <- scan_pvl(probs = probs, pheno = pheno, kinship = kinship, addcovar = ac,
start_snp = 1, n_snp = 80, n_cores = 1)
#> starting covariance matrices estimation with data from 284 subjects.
#> covariance matrices estimation completed.
tidy_scan_pvl(ss, pm = map)
#> # A tibble: 240 x 4
#>    marker_position     lod trace      Trace     
#>    <list>            <dbl> <chr>      <chr>     
#>  1 <NULL>           0      pleiotropy pleiotropy
#>  2 <NULL>          -0.0326 pleiotropy pleiotropy
#>  3 <NULL>          -0.0681 pleiotropy pleiotropy
#>  4 <NULL>          -0.106  pleiotropy pleiotropy
#>  5 <NULL>          -0.148  pleiotropy pleiotropy
#>  6 <NULL>          -0.191  pleiotropy pleiotropy
#>  7 <NULL>          -0.237  pleiotropy pleiotropy
#>  8 <NULL>          -0.286  pleiotropy pleiotropy
#>  9 <NULL>          -0.336  pleiotropy pleiotropy
#> 10 <NULL>          -0.388  pleiotropy pleiotropy
#> # … with 230 more rows
